message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.CY, cs.LG 

This paper is focused on analysing how people react to rumours associated with news in social media, specifically in Twitter. Therefore, it is likely to belong to the Computational Linguistics (cs.CL) sub-category, which deals with the study of computational aspects of the human language. Additionally, the paper explores the use of conversation-based and affective-based features, which could be related to the Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) and Sound and Music Computing (cs.SD) sub-categories, respectively. The paper also mentions the use of machine learning techniques, which could be related to the Cybersecurity (cs.CY) sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes a new approach that outperforms previous systems, which could be related to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category.
